docs.lead_paragraph: Huntington is not an ''All-America City,'' according to the National Civic League, which rejected the town in its fourth bid for the coveted designation last week. The contest, sponsored by the civic league and the Allstate Insurance Company, had narrowed to 30 finalists, which included Huntington. It was the first time a Long Island town had made the finals since Setauket did it in 1952. Huntington entered the contest but failed to make the finals in 1971, 1972 and 2000.
docs.abstract: National Civic League, for fourth time, rejects bid by Huntington, Long Island, to be designated as All American City (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: The optimistic picture that Vice President Dick Cheney's doctors painted today after successfully implanting a pacemaker and defibrillator in his chest is based on a number of recent studies of similar cases, but is shadowed by the frequent cardiac related episodes that Mr. Cheney has suffered in recent months. At a news conference, the doctors from George Washington University Medical Center, where Mr. Cheney has had his care for nearly 25 years, were obviously happy with the speed and facility that led them to complete electrophysiologic studies and implant the device in less than two hours. The doctors were also optimistic about Mr. Cheney's prognosis, which, his cardiologist, Dr. Jonathan S. Reiner, said was ''terrific.''
docs.abstract: Lawrence K Altman news analysis says that optimistic picture presented by Vice Pres Cheney's doctors after implantation of pacemaker-defibrillator is based on studies of similar cases, but is shadowed by frequent cardiac episodes Cheney has suffered since election; cardiologist Jonathan S Reiner terms prognosis 'terrific,' but recent episodes raise questions about whether Cheney's condition is deteriorating; he is now 60 and had first heart attack at 37 (M)
docs.snippet: The optimistic picture that Vice President Dick Cheney's doctors painted today after successfully implanting a pacemaker and defibrillator in his chest is based on a number of recent studies of similar cases, but is shadowed by the frequent cardiac...

docs.lead_paragraph: Doctors successfully implanted a sophisticated pacemaker and defibrillator in Vice President Dick Cheney's chest today, his medical team said. It was the third significant cardiac procedure Mr. Cheney has undergone since his election as vice president. In less than two hours, while Mr. Cheney slept under mild sedation, his doctors concluded that his heart was susceptible to abnormal, rapid heartbeats and installed the device as what they and Mr. Cheney called ''an insurance policy.''

headline.main: CHENEY GETS HEART DEVICE AND DECLARES, 'I FEEL GOOD'

docs.abstract: Doctors at George Washington University Medical Center implant sophisticated pacemaker and defibrillator into Vice Pres Dick Cheney's chest, third significant cardiac procedure he has undergone since taking office; device is described as 'insurance policy' because Cheney's heart is susceptible to abnormal, rapid heartbeats; Cheney leaves hospital hours later, saying 'I feel good'; Pres Bush predicts Cheney will be at work when week begins; cardiologist Jonathan S Reiner explains; photos; device under skin near collarbone responds to irregularity by sending small electrical jolt to heart, acting both as traditional pacemaker but also sa miniature defibrillator that can interrupt potentially fatal rapid heartbeats before they are fatal; Reiner insists Cheney's 'overall condition' is stable despite long history of heart disease (M)

byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER and LAWRENCE K. ALTMAN

docs.lead_paragraph: Union organizers are turning their attention to upscale food stores, like the Jefferson Market, Balducci's, Gourmet Garage and Dean & Deluca, pressing for better benefits for their workers. At the 72-year-old Jefferson Market, on the Avenue of Americas near 10th Street, more than 200 labor advocates showed up on June 14 to protest what one placard described as ''Upscale prices, bargain basement benefits.''

headline.main: Unions Go Organizing in the Aisles of Mangoes and Mesclun

docs.abstract: Article on union organizing effort coordinated by United Food and Commercial Workers Local 1500 at upscale food stores in Jefferson Market in Manhattan's Greenwich Village; photo (M)
